qas.question: Which New York State Attorney General filed suit in US District Court to force GE to pay for the cleanup of chemicals dumped by their plant in Waterford, NY?
How much did GE agree to pay in claims for the pollution it caused in the Housatonic River and other sites?
How many tons of PCBs were claimed to have been dumped by GE's Waterford Plant in the 1983 lawsuit?
In which year was a settlement reached regarding GE's pollution of the Housatonic River?
What was the location of the pollution caused by GE in the Housatonic River?
In what year was the suit against GE by New York State Attorney General Robert Abrams settled?
How much money did GE pay to settle the lawsuit filed against it by the New York State Attorney General in 1983?
What river is near GE's plant in Waterford, New York?

plausible_answers.text: United States District Court for the Northern District of New York

qas.question: Where was the lawsuit filed against GE in connection to it polluting the Housatonic River?
What was the name of the attorney general who filed a suit against GE for it polluting the Housatonic River?

context: Năm 1983, Tổng chưởng lý Tiểu bang New York <a0_0><b9_0> Robert Abrams <b9_0/><a0_0/> nộp phù hợp trong <b8_0> Tòa án quận Hoa Kỳ cho quận phía Bắc của New York <b8_0/> để buộc GE phải trả tiền cho việc dọn dẹp những gì được cho là <a2_0> hơn 100.000 <a2_0/> tấn hóa chất được đổ từ nhà máy của họ ở Waterford, New York. Trong <a3_0><b5_0> 1999 <b5_0/><a3_0/> , công ty đã đồng ý thanh toán <a1_0><b6_0> 250 triệu đô la <b6_0/><a1_0/> giải quyết trong kết nối với tuyên bố nó bị ô nhiễm <b7_0> Sông Housatonic <b7_0/> ( <a4_0> Pittsfield, Massachusetts <a4_0/> ) và các địa điểm khác có biphenyls polychlorinated (PCB) và các chất độc hại khác.
